author: tom collomosse
title: Mauricio Pochettino backs Harry Kane to challenge Alan Shearer's goal record
text:
Friday 10 March 2017 14:38 GMT Click to followES Sport Pochettino congratulates Kane after another goal for Spurs Tottenham Hotspur FC via Getty Images 
Harry Kane is capable of succeeding Alan Shearer as the Premier League’s record goalscorer, according to Tottenham boss Mauricio Pochettino . 
Kane is on track to retain the golden boot he won last season, and has 68 goals in 108 matches in England’s top flight. 
While that total is still some way short of Shearer’s tally of 260, Pochettino believes Kane has the time on his side, and the hunger, to overtake the England great. 
"Our wish is that he gets close to Shearer, who was one of the best, an unbelievable player," said Pochettino. "Why not? ‘Kane went the extra mile at Millwall and that’s why he’s at the top' 
"Harry is still very young with the potential to improve a lot, so why not, one day – even though we are talking about an unbelievable player like Shearer.” 
Kane was this week named the Premier League player of the month for February and has eight goals in his last four matches in all competitions.
